summary: ENB+sweetFX preset tweaked with performance in mind and without overusing effects. subtle DOF and beatiful look.
descriptionHtml:
[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/qCkLpOp.jpg[/img][/center]

[center]Good people of the nexus, i present you:
[font=Comic Sans MS][color=#f1c232][size=6]humblENB[/size][/color][/font][/center]
While i was tweaking these settings i kept my eye on the fps counter. this way and depending on the different zones in the game my fps never went lower than 45 capped at a max of 50. effects were never overused so the vanilla feel was mainly kept, only giving a natural enhancement to the final result.

keep in mind that ENB shaders are usualy very hungry performance wise. all of the above was achieved using a GTX760 2GB. performance may vary depending on your system.

This is my first contribution to the nexus so feel free to post your images and insight on this one. harsh comments will be ignored.


[center][color=#ff7700][size=4][b]Installation:
[/b][/size][/color][/center]1- download [url=http://enbdev.com/mod_tesskyrim_v0264.htm]ENB series v0.264[/url] and extract only d3d9.dll and enbhost to your skyrim folder.(usualy located at steam/steamapps/common/skyrim)
2- download the zip from the downloads section and extract everything to the same location as step 1.
3- in skyrim launcher disable all forms of AA, AF and FXAA (ENB handles these effects much better and this will also prevent graphycal issues like dissapearing textures)
4- open skyrimprefs.ini (located in documents/my games/skyrim)
5- change the following lines as you see fit.

[color=#ffd966]bTreesReceiveShadows=0[/color] (change to 1 if you want shadows on trees)
[color=#ffd966]bShadowsOnGrass=0[/color] (change to 1 if you want shadows on grass)
(performance impact is minimal unless you use mods that add a lot of density to grass)
[color=#ffd966]bFloatPointRenderTarget=1     [/color](setting this to 1 is mandatory for all ENBs to work properly)

*I recommend you follow [url=http://wiki.step-project.com/Guide:ENB#tab=Editing_Enblocal_INI]ENB S.T.E.P. guide[/url] to properly configure your Enblocal.ini according to your system.

*(advanced users) you might want to check wich vsync option works best for you.

I recomend using mods like [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/32505/?]Skyrim Project Optimization[/url] and unoficial skyrim+dlc patches to keep your game stable and fluid.
I also used [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/12801/?]Optimizer Textures[/url] to compress my textures. this tool gives a huge performance boost and the quality loss is barely noticeable.
(careful how you use it tho)[center][color=#ff7700][size=4][b]
Recommended Mods:[/b][/size][/color][/center][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/27043/?]Enhanced Lights and FX[/url] - the lighting overhaul that i use. most likely what you need to make your game look like the screenshots
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/1305814/?tb=mods&pUp=1]JK's cities[/url] - set of mods i use to enhance the major cities in Skyrim
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/139369/?tb=mods&pUp=1]tamriel reloaded mods[/url] - set of mods i use to enhance the world of skyrim
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/17416/?]wearable lanterns[/url] - when you need that edge on those "dark-interior" situations.


[color=#ff7700][size=4][b][center]Credits:[/center][/b][/size][/color][center][size=2]First of all, the amazing nexus comunity. thank you for making even better what was already awesome.
Bethesda - for making Skyrim.[/size]
[url=http://www.enbdev.com/]Boris Vorontsov[/url] - creator of ENB series.
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/151807/?]Matso[/url] - DOF effect on this preset
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/50638/?tab=1&navtag=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nexusmods.com%2Fskyrim%2Fajax%2Fmoddescription%2F%3Fid%3D50638%26preview%3D&pUp=1]Post-Process Effects Addon for ENB[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/45054/?]Lens Textures for ENB[/url]
[url=http://pinkfirefly135.deviantart.com/]lensmask texture
[/url][/center][center]*If anyone feel i should credit them here and i forgot to, please let me know and i'll fix the problem the best way you see fit.[/center]
author: humbleiplay
